Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.description: The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.

enumDescriptions.AuthNone: Requests without any sort of authentication are allowed.
enumDescriptions.BasicAuth: Requests using HTTP Basic authentication are allowed.
enumDescriptions.OemAuth: Requests using OEM authentication mechanisms are allowed.
enumDescriptions.RedfishSessionAuth: Requests using Redfish session authentication are allowed.

CredentialBootstrapping.description: The credential bootstrapping settings for this interface.
CredentialBootstrapping.longDescription: This type shall contain settings for the Redfish Host Interface Specification-defined 'credential bootstrapping via IPMI commands' feature for this interface.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

EnableAfterReset.description: An indication of whether credential bootstrapping is enabled after a reset for this interface.
EnableAfterReset.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether credential bootstrapping is enabled after a reset for this interface.  If `true`, services shall set the Enabled property to `true` after a reset of the host or the service.

Enabled.description: An indication of whether credential bootstrapping is enabled for this interface.
Enabled.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether credential bootstrapping is enabled for this interface.

RoleId.description: The role used for the bootstrap account created for this interface.
RoleId.longDescription: This property shall contain the Id property of the role resource that is used for the bootstrap account created for this interface.

HostInterface.description: The properties associated with a Redfish host interface.  A Redfish host interface is a connection between host software and a Redfish service.
HostInterface.longDescription: This resource shall represent a Redfish host interface as part of the Redfish Specification.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Actions.description: The available actions for this resource.
Actions.longDescription: This property shall contain the available actions for this resource.

AuthNoneRoleId.description: The role when no authentication on this interface is used.
AuthNoneRoleId.longDescription: This property shall contain the Id property of the Role resource that is used when no authentication on this interface is performed.  This property shall be absent if `AuthNone` is not supported by the service for the AuthenticationModes property.

AuthenticationModes.description: The authentication modes available on this interface.
AuthenticationModes.longDescription: This property shall contain an array consisting of the authentication modes allowed on this interface.

CredentialBootstrapping.description: The credential bootstrapping settings for this interface.
CredentialBootstrapping.longDescription: This property shall contain settings for the Redfish Host Interface Specification-defined 'credential bootstrapping via IPMI commands' feature for this interface.  This property shall be absent if credential bootstrapping is not supported by the service.

ExternallyAccessible.description: An indication of whether external entities can access this interface.  External entities are non-host entities.  For example, if the host and manager are connected through a switch and the switch also exposes an external port on the system, external clients can also use the interface, and this property value is `true`.
ExternallyAccessible.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether external entities can access this interface.  External entities are non-host entities.  For example, if the host and manager are connected through a switch and the switch also exposes an external port on the system, external clients can also use the interface, and this property value is `true`.

FirmwareAuthEnabled.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of newer methods of negotiating credentials.
FirmwareAuthEnabled.description: An indication of whether this firmware authentication is enabled for this interface.
FirmwareAuthEnabled.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether firmware authentication is enabled for this interface.

FirmwareAuthRoleId.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of newer methods of negotiating credentials.
FirmwareAuthRoleId.description: The Redfish role used for firmware authentication on this interface.
FirmwareAuthRoleId.longDescription: This property shall contain the Id property of the Role resource that is configured for firmware authentication on this interface.

HostEthernetInterfaces.description: A link to the collection of network interface controllers or cards (NICs) that a computer system uses to communicate with this host interface.
HostEthernetInterfaces.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource collection of type EthernetInterfaceCollection that computer systems use as the host interface to this manager.

HostInterfaceType.description: The host interface type for this interface.
HostInterfaceType.longDescription: This property shall contain the host interface type for this interface.

InterfaceEnabled.description: An indication of whether this interface is enabled.
InterfaceEnabled.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether this interface is enabled.

KernelAuthEnabled.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of newer methods of negotiating credentials.
KernelAuthEnabled.description: An indication of whether this kernel authentication is enabled for this interface.
KernelAuthEnabled.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether kernel authentication is enabled for this interface.

KernelAuthRoleId.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of newer methods of negotiating credentials.
KernelAuthRoleId.description: The Redfish role used for kernel authentication on this interface.
KernelAuthRoleId.longDescription: This property shall contain the Id property of the Role resource that is configured for kernel authentication on this interface.

Links.description: The links to other resources that are related to this resource.
Links.longDescription: This property shall contain links to resources that are related to but are not contained by, or subordinate to, this resource.

ManagerEthernetInterface.description: A link to a single network interface controllers or cards (NIC) that this manager uses for network communication with this host interface.
ManagerEthernetInterface.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource of type EthernetInterface that represents the network interface that this manager uses as the host interface.

NetworkProtocol.description: A link to the network services and their settings that the manager controls.  In this property, clients find configuration options for the network and network services.
NetworkProtocol.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource of type ManagerNetworkProtocol that represents the network services for this manager.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties that this object contains shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

Status.description: The status and health of the resource and its subordinate or dependent resources.
Status.longDescription: This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.

enumDescriptions.NetworkHostInterface: This interface is a network host interface.

Links.description: The links to other resources that are related to this resource.
Links.longDescription: This Redfish Specification-described type shall contain links to resources that are related to but are not contained by, or subordinate to, this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

AuthNoneRole.description: The link to the Redfish role that contains the privileges on this host interface when no authentication is performed.
AuthNoneRole.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource of type Role, and should link to the resource identified by property AuthNoneRoleId.  This property shall be absent if `AuthNone` is not supported by the service for the AuthenticationModes property.

ComputerSystems.description: An array of links to the computer systems connected to this host interface.
ComputerSystems.longDescription: This property shall contain an array of links to resources of type ComputerSystem that are connected to this host interface.

CredentialBootstrappingRole.description: The link to the role that contains the privileges for the bootstrap account created for this interface.
CredentialBootstrappingRole.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource of type Role, and should link to the resource identified by the RoleId property within CredentialBootstrapping.  This property shall be absent if the Redfish Host Interface Specification-defined 'credential bootstrapping via IPMI commands' feature is not supported by the service.

FirmwareAuthRole.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of newer methods of negotiating credentials.
FirmwareAuthRole.description: The link to the Redfish role that has firmware authentication privileges on this host interface.
FirmwareAuthRole.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource of type Role, and should link to the resource identified by property FirmwareAuthRoleId.

KernelAuthRole.deprecated: This property has been deprecated in favor of newer methods of negotiating credentials.
KernelAuthRole.description: The link to the Redfish role defining privileges for this host interface when using kernel authentication.
KernelAuthRole.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource of type Role, and should link to the resource identified by property KernelAuthRoleId.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties contained in this object shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

OemActions.description: The available OEM-specific actions for this resource.
OemActions.longDescription: This type shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

title: #HostInterface.v1_3_1.HostInterface
